bug.author: davidbren
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
Created a custom NER model the cfg file is showing my entities multiple times "extra_labels":[ "PAY", "PAY", "PAY", "PAY", "CPTI", "CPTI", "CPTI", "CPTI", "CHG_Amts", "CHG_Amts", "CHG_Amts", "CHG_Amts" ], <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: Windows 7 Python Version Used: 3.6 spaCy Version Used: 2.0.18 Environment Information:

comments.comment: I suspect that This might be due to your data format of list of list as you showed in#3120. Can you try with list of tuple to see if it helps. Otherwise share more details on the code you run to get this

My training set is a local json file to read it in I deserialize using the following <denchmark-code>with open(localFilePath,encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) </denchmark-code>
If I convert to a list of tuples this fails I re-checked the code where I add the labels <denchmark-code> for _, annotations in trainData: for ent in annotations.get('entities'): ner.add_label(ent[2]) </denchmark-code>
ent[2] = 'PAY' so this seems correct ? Have you any examples of a local json file of training data ?

Looks like this is related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/2179>#2179</denchmark-link> . It should be fixed in the latest already â€“ you can install the latest release from pip and rerun your code to check

I don't know I am thinking that maybe their is something wrong with my representation as the issue in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/3120>#3120</denchmark-link> , seems to suggest their is something going on. By any chance have you any examples of a local file of training data being deserialized, it would really help, even better if you have any that are compatible with json.load()
I reworked the format changing the lists to tuples & it made no difference
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
